page.title: 14AUTUMN BEACH
page.content: Flaky sand crumbling through my hands. A dark creamy seashore decorated with patterns and foot prints. Beds of stones,never ending,piled in different colours and shapes. Jet,amber,granite,quartz and limestone all mingled together. An unlevel beach deserted and alone. Cans and paper litter fills the sandy holes and steep passageways where the sea will soon lap in. Old battered groynes with giants crooked teeth mouldy and crumbling just rotting away. Tiny grains of fine sand smother them. A gentle storm of cool,soft sand. only stones and strangly shaped shells lie on the lonely beach,listening to waves chattering. The cold East wind nips along the sand and howls through marram grass dunes. Alison Clark age 10
